V_join_documents.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE V_join_documents (
            id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            method_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            doc_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,  
            FOREIGN KEY (method_id) REFERENCES test_and_verification (method_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
            FOREIGN KEY (doc_id) REFERENCES documents (doc_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
        )

documents.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE documents (
            doc_id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,
            title VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            description VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            file BLOB,
            version INTEGER,
            author TEXT CHECK (author IN ('E.Z','C.N','Y.M.B','E.M','A.H')),
            file_name TEXT,
            mime_type TEXT
        )

drone_swarm_requirements.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE drone_swarm_requirements (
            swarm_req_id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
            requirement VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            priority TEXT CHECK (priority IN ('Key','Mandatory','Optional')),
            effect VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            rationale VARCHAR,
            author TEXT CHECK (author IN ('E.Z','C.N','Y.M.B','E.M','A.H')),
            verification_status TEXT CHECK (verification_status IN ('TBR','Reviewed','Accepted', 'Rejected')),
            verifier TEXT CHECK (verifier IN ('E.Z','C.N','Y.M.B','E.M','A.H','TBR')),
            validation_status TEXT CHECK (validation_status IN ('Pending','Failed','Verified','Inconclusive')),
            vv_method VARCHAR,
            comment VARCHAR,
            FOREIGN KEY (vv_method) REFERENCES test_and_verification (method_id) ON DELETE SET NULL
        )

rows.requirement: When a mission is started, the swarm shall assign tasks to agents according to the mission plan,considering any available differences in agent capability.
rows.rationale: When operating with a heterogeneous swarm, task assignment shall account for both the mission plan and the specific capabilities of each agent, ensuring that differences in agent capabilities are explicitly considered.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: If an agent experiences a degradation in its functionality, the swarm shall reassign that agent's tasks to other functional agents, depending on the available resources of the functional agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: If an agent experiences a degradation in its functionality, the agent shall take on less critical task(s), provided the agent is capable of performing these task(s).
rows.rationale: As the stakeholder has requested maximum efficiency, this requirement ensures that tasks are assigned optimally according to both the mission plan and agent capabilities.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The swarm shall employ a consensus mechanism that ensures correct collective behaviour, even if at least one agent provides incorrect data.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The swarm shall reach a collective decision for each task that requires coordination.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The swarm shall coordinate all agents to distribute the search area such that each agent searches a different portion the search area.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: When local conditions of an agent require immediate action,the swarm shall allow the agent to make independent decisions
rows.rationale: Since the swarm has no leader, agents should be able to make independent decision when necessary.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: When the staff is in the landing area, the swarm hover at a distance of atleast 40 m away from the landing area.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: When the swarm finds the subject, agents shall avoid flying above the subject.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: When the subject is confirmed to be found, the swarm shall fly atleast 50m away from the subject.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: Agents shall have a 25m buffer zone around them.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: If agents' buffer zones overlap then the agents whose buffer zones are oerlapping shall move away from each other.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: If position data of an agent in the swarm is delayed, then that culprit agent shall increase its buffer zone by atleast 20m.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: If position data of an agent in the swarm is uncertain, then that culprit agent shall increase its buffer zone by atleast 20m.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: If flight capacity of an agent in the swarm is decreased, then that culprit agent shall increase its buffer zone by atleast 20m.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: If communication of an agent in the swarm is delayed, then that culprit agent shall increase its buffer zone by atleast 20m.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: Agents shall fly a minimum of 15m above ground.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: Agent shall avoid  obstacles.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: When the mission is in progress, Agent shall use sensors  to detect stationary obstacles. Rationale:for situational awareness
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: When the mission is in progress, Agent shall use sensors for situational awareness to detect air obstacles.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: Swarm shall operate in areas with a population < 5 people per km^2.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: If agents communication is lost, agent shall return to base.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: If agents power unit is degraded, agent shall return to base if possible.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: If agent battery power is below 50%, agent shall return to base.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: If agent flight is unstable, agent shall return to base.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: While an agent is in searching state, the agent shall fly at an altitude between 15-20 m above ground.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The operational volume shall have add 50m to all sides as a bufferzone
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: If an agent enters the operational areas buffer zone, the agent shall return to the operational area
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: If an agent leaves the operational areas buffer zone, the agent shall land
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: When the mission is in progress, swarm agents shall send out location updates periodically to other agents in the same swarm.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: When the staff is atleast 20m away from the swarm, the swarm shall proced with startup sequence.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: While an agent is in transition state, agent shall stay between 25-40m above ground.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: Agents shall fly a maxsimum of 50m above ground
rows.author: E.M

goal_children.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE goal_children (
            id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            goal_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            swarm_req_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            FOREIGN KEY (goal_id) REFERENCES goals (goal_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
            FOREIGN KEY (swarm_req_id) REFERENCES drone_swarm_requirements(swarm_req_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
        )

goals.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE goals (
            goal_id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY,
            goal_description VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            stakeholder VARCHAR,
            origin VARCHAR,
            priority TEXT CHECK (priority IN ('Key','Mandatory','Optional')),
            rationale VARCHAR,
            satisfaction_status TEXT CHECK (satisfaction_status IN ('Pending','Not satisfied','Satisfied')),
            method_id VARCHAR,
            FOREIGN KEY (method_id) REFERENCES test_and_verification (method_id) ON DELETE SET NULL
        )

rows.goal_description: Design logic to assign an appropriate task to each agent at the start of the mission.
Ensure that when an agent fails, its assigned tasks are automatically reassigned to other functional agents, if system resources permit.
Ensure that correct behaviour is maintained across the swarm despite failure or inconsistencies in the output of a single agent.
Ensure that the swarm reaches a collective decision for each task that requires coordination.
rows.rationale: A decentralised protocol means that the swarm has no leader and hence should be able to make collective decisions.

rows.goal_description: Ensure coordination among all agents when distributing the search area.
Ensure that the provided simulation software is modified so that the implemented replanning protocol can be tested in that simulation environment.
Enable the application of fault injection within the simulation to test system resilience and fault tolerance.
Demonstrate that the swarm can maintain mission continuity despite disruptions, failures, or changes in agent availability while operating under the chosen protocol.
Demonstrate that the swarm can recover from individual agent failures and continue operating effectively as a collective.
Measure the time required to locate the target subject using the newly implemented chosen protocol, in order to evaluate its performance.
Ensure that agents can make individual decisions in appropriate situations.
rows.rationale: Collective decision-making implies the absence of a central controller, requiring agents to operate autonomously. Therefore, agents must be capable of making independent decisions when necessary, including the ability to self-remove from the swarm in response to failure, inefficiency, or conflict with global objectives.

rows.goal_description: All staff must be safe in all operational phases.
Agents should not pose any threat to the subject.
Agents should not cause a collision with each other, minimum distance from each other 30 m.
Agents should not collide with ground or ground obstacles, minimum altitude 15m.
Agents should not collide with third parties in the air, max altitude above ground 50 m
The swarm should only fly in rural areas.
Damaged agent should return home if damage is critical or battery low.
The agents should move at different altitudes depending on the task, searching 15-20m, moving from one sector to another, 25-40m.
The probability of the failure condition “UA leaving the operational volume” shall be less than 10-3/Flight Hour (FH).
When the UA leaves the operational volume, an immediate end of the flight must be initiated through a combination of procedures/processes and/or available technical means.
The Ground Risk Buffer must at least adhere to the 1:1 principle.

id_glossary.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE id_glossary (
            gloss_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            prefix VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            meaning VARCHAR NOT NULL  
        )

rows.meaning: Goals derived from project task description
Requirements pertaining to the drone swarm

quality_requirements.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE quality_requirements (
            quality_rec_id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY, 
            requirement VARCHAR, 
            author TEXT CHECK (author IN ('E.Z','C.N','Y.M.B','E.M','A.H')),
            approved_by TEXT CHECK (approved_by IN ('Y.M.B') OR approved_by IS NULL)
        )

subsystem_requirements.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE subsystem_requirements (
            parent_id VARCHAR,
            sub_req_id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,
            requirement VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            priority TEXT CHECK (priority IN ('Key','Mandatory','Optional')),
            effect VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            rationale VARCHAR,
            author TEXT CHECK (author IN ('E.Z','C.N','Y.M.B','E.M','A.H')),
            verification_status TEXT CHECK (verification_status IN ('TBR','Reviewed','Accepted', 'Rejected')),
            verifier TEXT CHECK (verifier IN ('E.Z','C.N','Y.M.B','E.M','A.H','TBR')),
            validation_status TEXT CHECK (validation_status IN ('Pending','Failed','Verified','Inconclusive')),
            vv_method VARCHAR,
            comment VARCHAR,
            FOREIGN KEY (parent_id) REFERENCES subsystem_requirements (sub_req_id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
            FOREIGN KEY (vv_method) REFERENCES test_and_verification (method_id) ON DELETE SET NULL
        )

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall specify how agents confirm agreement on the prevailing mission state.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The information sub-module shall define the content of mission state data.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define the communication rules for transmitting mission state information between agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The state instruction sub-module shall define the procedures for issuing instructions to agents based on the current mission state.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall define the procedures that agents will follow to reach a common understanding of the mission plan.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The information module shall specify procedures that agents will follow so as to retrieve the mission plan.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The information shall define the data structure that constitutes the mission plan.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define the communication procedures for transmitting mission plan data between agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define acknowledgment procedures to ensure complete delivery of the mission plan to all intended agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall specify the message formats used for mission plan exchange.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The state instruction sub-module shall specify the process agents must follow after receiving mission plan.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall specify how agents confirm agreement on final task allocations.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The information sub-module shall define the data structure used to represent tasks.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define the communication procedures for distributing task assignment messages to agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall specify message formats for transmitting task allocation information.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define acknowledgment procedures to ensure that all agents receive their assigned tasks.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The state instruction sub-module shall define the conditions under which agents initiate task execution based on the confirmed assignment.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall specify the criteria used to determine which agent is assigned a given task.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall define the procedure for mapping mission plan objectives to specific agent tasks.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The information sub-module shall define the data schema representing agent capabilities.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define the communication procedures that agents shall use to transmit capability information to other agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall specify the message formats that agents shall use to transmit capability information to other agents
rows.author: C.N
rows.comment: Capability information may also be known as health status.

rows.requirement: The state instruction sub-module shall define the conditions under which capability information influences mission plan.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall define procedures for agents to decide on capability-based task assignments.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall specify conflict-resolution procedures when multiple agents are equally capable of performing the same task.
rows.rationale: The priority of this requirement depends on the chosen implementatation. Some implementation might inherently take care of this, however those that dont will need to observe this requirement.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall define the rules for mapping capabilities to specific tasks.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall define the procedures for agents to agree on task re-assignments.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The information sub-module shall define the data model linking agent capabilities with corresponding task requirements.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The information sub-module shall specify procedures for updating task assignment records when re-assignments occur.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define acknowledgment rules to ensure that all affected agents reliably receive re-assignment notifications.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall define the triggers for initiating a task re-assignment.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall specify the procedure for selecting a new agent for a re-assigned task based on the prevailing agent capabilities.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define the procedures for exchanging task re-assignment messages between agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define the standard message structure for task re-assignment proposals.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define the communication procedure for transmitting degraded status notifications to other agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall specify the identifiers for status messages.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The information sub-module shall specify procedures for evaluating the criticality level of each task.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall define procedures for using criticality levels to assign tasks.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall specify rules for updating task priority when criticality changes.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall define procedures for identifying fully functional agents eligible to take over high-criticality tasks.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall define procedures for identifying degraded agents eligible for lower-criticality tasks based on their prevailing capabilities.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall specify rules for assigning lower-criticality tasks to degraded agents without exceeding their current capabilities.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall define procedures for validating data received from multiple agents.
rows.rationale: In order for the consensus mechanism to be robust (as goal G-03 states), there needs to be a way to validate data from multiple agents to ensure that the data being agreed upon is accurate and reliable. This is why the requirement is mandatory.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall define the conditions under which data is considered accepted as correct by all agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall specify rules for resolving conflicts when at least one agent provides incorrect data.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall define the rules that agents will follow to reach a collective decision for tasks that require coordination.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall define the procedures that agents will follow to reach a collective decision for tasks that require coordination.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define procedures for transmitting search area boundary information between agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall specify message formats for boundary data.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define the procedures for exchanging search area information between agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall define procedures for agents to agree on which agent searches which portion of the area.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall define procedures for assigning portions of the search area to agents based on a collective decision.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall define the rules that specify when consensus is required for a task.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall specify conditions under which an agent may act independently without seeking consensus.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The state instruction sub-module shall define the actions an agent is permitted to take in states where independent decision-making is allowed.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The state instruction sub-module shall specify the procedure for reporting independent decisions to other agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall specify what information is included in messages that inform other agents about an agent’s independent decision.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall define the procedure for sending notifications of independent actions to other agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The messaging sub-module shall specify message formats for independent action notifications.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The consensus sub-module shall define rules for reconciling independently made decisions with the swarm’s shared state.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The information sub-module shall specify procedures for updating the shared state after reintegration.
rows.rationale: This requirement intends to ensure consistency across the swarm.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The task allocation sub-module shall assign each high-criticality task only to agents whose capabilities match the task requirements.
rows.author: C.N

swarm_req_children.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE swarm_req_children (
            id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            swarm_req_id VARCHAR  NOT NULL,
            sys_req_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            FOREIGN KEY (sys_req_id) REFERENCES system_requirements (sys_req_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
            FOREIGN KEY (swarm_req_id) REFERENCES drone_swarm_requirements (swarm_req_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
        )

sysreq_children.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE sysreq_children(
            id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            sys_req_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            sub_req_id VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            FOREIGN KEY (sys_req_id) REFERENCES system_requirements (sys_req_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
            FOREIGN KEY (sub_req_id) REFERENCES subsystem_requirements (sub_req_id) ON DELETE CASCADE
        )

system_requirements.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE system_requirements (
            parent_id VARCHAR,
            sys_req_id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,
            requirement VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            priority TEXT CHECK (priority IN ('Key','Mandatory','Optional')),
            effect VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            rationale VARCHAR,
            author TEXT CHECK (author IN ('E.Z','C.N','Y.M.B','E.M','A.H')),
            verification_status TEXT CHECK (verification_status IN ('TBR','Reviewed','Accepted', 'Rejected')),
            verifier TEXT CHECK (verifier IN ('E.Z','C.N','Y.M.B','E.M','A.H','TBR')),
            validation_status TEXT CHECK (validation_status IN ('Pending','Failed','Verified','Inconclusive')),
            vv_method VARCHAR,
            comment VARCHAR,
            FOREIGN KEY (parent_id) REFERENCES system_requirements (sys_req_id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
            FOREIGN KEY (vv_method) REFERENCES test_and_verification (method_id) ON DELETE SET NULL
        )

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures will be taken so that all agents are aware of the prevailing mission state.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that all agents shall follow to share the mission plan.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define procedures on how tasks are assigned to agents depending on the mission plan.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that all agents shall follow to communicate their (all agents) capabilities.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the message formats that all agents shall use to communicate their (all agents) capabilities.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that all agents follow to assign tasks to agents based on the agents' capabilities.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the rules that all agents will adhere to when re-assigning tasks.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents follow to exchange task re-assignment proposals.
rows.rationale: the module must define both rules and procedures for task re-assignment.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the message format that all agents will use to exchange task re-assignment proposals.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedure that agents experiencing degrade functionality shall follow so as to communicate their degraded status to other agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the rules that agents follow to identify the criticality of tasks.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define procedures that agents follow toassign high-criticality tasks to fully functional agents when any agent's functionality becomes degraded.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define procedures that agents follow to assign lower-criticality tasks to agents experiencing degraded functionality based on their (the degraded agent(s)) prevailing capabilities.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the rules that agents follow to reach agreement on correct data, even if at least one agent provides incorret data.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the rules that agents will follow to reach a collective decision for tasks that require coordination.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents will follow to reach a collective decision for tasks that require coordination.
rows.rationale: PM-16 and PM-15 are important to highlight the need for both rules and procedures.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the rules that agents follow to share information about the boundaries of their assigned search areas.
rows.rationale: this requirement intends to ensure that the final design avoid overlap of search areas among agents.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the message-exchange rules that enable agents and agree on which agent searches what portion of the area.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the conditions under which an agent is permitted to make independent decisions without prior consensus.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents follow to notify other agents after taking an independent action.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the rules that agents follow to reintegrate independent decisions into the swarm’s shared state once the communication with other agents is resumed.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define procedures that allow agents to mitigate incorrect data received from at least one agent during consensus.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the rules that ensure agents base their consensus decisions only on verified data.
rows.author: C.N

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that will be taken so that all agents sart in a safe way.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents shall take when aproaching landing area.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the distance from the landing area when staff are present.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents shall take when subject is found.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the distance frome the subject when subject is found.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the ruels for agents broadcasting thier position.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the buffer zone for all agents.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the prcedures that will be taken when agent buffer zones overlap.
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the prcedures that will be taken when agent position data is delayed
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the prcedures that will be taken when agent position data is uncertain
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the prcedures that will be taken when agent flight capacity is decreased
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the prcedures that will be taken when agent communication is delayed
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the minimum hight above ground for all agents
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents shall take when avoiding stationary obstacles
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents shall take when avoiding air obstacles
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the operational volume based on input
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents shall take when agent comunication is lost
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents shall take when agent power unit is degraded
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents shall take when agent battery is below 50%
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents shall take when agent flight is unstable
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the maximum and minimum altitudes for searching state
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the maximum and minimum altitudes for transsition state
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the the buffur zone of the operational volume
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents shall take when entering the operational volume buffer zone
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the procedures that agents shall take when leaving the operational volumes buffer zone outer border
rows.author: E.M

rows.requirement: The protocol module shall define the maxsimum hight above ground for all agents
rows.author: E.M

test_and_verification.create_sql:
CREATE TABLE test_and_verification (
            method_id VARCHAR PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL,
            description VARCHAR NOT NULL,
            method_type TEXT CHECK (method_type IN ('Inspection','Analysis','Test'))    
        )
